DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to a diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by surgery or hormones synthesized in the cortex of the adrenal gland and consist of two subclasses, glucocorticoids (carbohydrate regulation) and mineralocorticoids (electrolyte regulation

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by surgery or hormones synthesized in the cortex of the adrenal gland and consist of two subclasses, glucocorticoids (carbohydrate regulation) and mineralocorticoids (electrolyte regulation).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: Hormones synthesized in the cortex of the adrenal gland and consist of two subclasses, glucocorticoids (carbohydrate regulation) and mineralocorticoids (electrolyte regulation).(NCI):Given.

Concepts.definition: Hormones synthesized in the cortex of the adrenal gland and consist of two subclasses, glucocorticoids (carbohydrate regulation) and mineralocorticoids (electrolyte regulation).
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results or effects (does not include CTC Adverse Events) of therapeutic agents or procedures administered to the patient.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Prior to study enrollment, ha
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior to study enrollment, has patient been treated with therapy other than surgical intervention and corticosteroids?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received any prior tumor-directed therapy other than surgical intervention and/or corticosteroids?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received any prior radiation therapy or chemotherapy (tumor-directed therapy) other than surgical intervention and/or corticosteroids?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received any prior tumor-directed therapy other than surgical intervention and/or corticosteroids?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 100
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received any prior tumor-directed therapy including chemotherapy, radiation therapy, immunotherapy, or bone marrow transplant for the treatment of HGG other than surgical intervention and/or corticosteroids?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text  12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received any prior tumor-directed therapy (other than surgical intervention and corticosteroids) for their current diagnosis of CNS NGGCT?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 001
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received any prior radiation therapy or chemotherapy (tumor-directed therapy) other than surgical intervention and/or corticosteroids?
